title: Sarah Sanders Is on a Roll — Now She’s Caught the NYT, Red-Handed, Saying Nice Things About Trump
text:
Conservative Fighters
Sarah Sanders Is on a Roll — Now She’s Caught the NYT, Red-Handed, Saying Nice Things About Trump
One of President Donald Trump’s regular pastimes is pointing out what those in the “fake news” media are doing wrong.
On a fairly regular basis, White House press secretary Sarah Huckabee Sanders follows suit.
Greatest story of the year: booming @realDonaldTrump economy.
Here is the official audio showing WSJ misquoting @POTUS pic.twitter.com/wVwoafYkHg
Here is the official audio showing WSJ misquoting @POTUS pic.twitter.com/wVwoafYkHg
We first contacted the WSJ Friday morning and asked for a correction. They repeatedly refused to issue one despite clear audio evidence they'd misquoted POTUS. https://t.co/yauftW3qDQ
But she is also willing to give credit where credit is due. On Saturday, she praised The Washington Post for recognizing the Trump economy:
"The United States suddenly finds itself at a place where almost everyone who wants a job can find one…raising the prospect of higher wages." -Washington Post on the booming @realDonaldTrump economy
And on Sunday morning, she delivered similar praise to The New York Times:
“The American economy hasn’t experienced this kind of fierce competition for workers since the late 1990s and early 2000s, the last time the unemployment rate was this low.” -NY Times
Even for the critics it's becoming harder to deny the success of year one of Trump presidency
Who’s next?
Related Topics: News
January 16, 2018 at 9:52 pm
It’s about time that the Dems and complainers take off the blindfolds and recognize the good that President Trump has done so far for this Country.

quotes: The United States suddenly finds itself at a place where almost everyone who wants a job can find one…raising the prospect of higher wages.
The American economy hasn’t experienced this kind of fierce competition for workers since the late 1990s and early 2000s, the last time the unemployment rate was this low.
